content.question:
The horizontal base of the rectangle is labeled with a length of 32 inches. The height of the rectangle is labeled with a length of 162 inches. The inscribed ellipse intersects each of the four sides of the rectangle at the midpoint of the side.

A designer wants to create a wooden table that features the shape of an ellipse, where the length of the table is much greater than the width. The ellipse would be inscribed in a rectangle with a base of <math alttext="32"><mn>32</mn></math> inches and a height of <math alttext="162"><mn>162</mn></math> inches, as shown in the figure. Which of the following gives the lengths of the horizontal and vertical radii of the ellipse?

choices.label: The horizontal radius is <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> inches, and the vertical radius is <math alttext="9"><mn>9</mn></math> inches.

The horizontal radius is <math alttext="4 square root of 2"><mn>4</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math> inches, and the vertical radius is <math alttext="9 square root of 2"><mn>9</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math> inches.
The horizontal radius is <math alttext="16"><mn>16</mn></math> inches, and the vertical radius is <math alttext="81"><mn>81</mn></math> inches.
The horizontal radius is <math alttext="32"><mn>32</mn></math> inches, and the vertical radius is <math alttext="162"><mn>162</mn></math> inches.

content.answer: The horizontal radius is <math alttext="16"><mn>16</mn></math> inches, and the vertical radius is <math alttext="81"><mn>81</mn></math> inches.
